result.execSummary:
The defendant John William Mosley III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

14CM2274: BTC DRI

15CF233: BTC: Cts 1-10 DRI.

14CF1330: Credit for time served.

15CF1357: Ct 1: 10 yrs, 6 yrs I/C, 4 yrs ES
Ct 2: 6 yrs, 3 yrs I/C, 3 yrs ES, concurrent to Count 1.
Ct 5: 10 yrs, 5 yrs I/C, 5 yrs ES, concurrent to Count 1
Ct 14: 6 yrs, 3 yrs I/C, 3 yrs ES, concurrent to Count 1 and 14CF1330.

Conditions:
Maintain absolute sobriety, no alcohol or controlled substances.
AODA assessment.
Random UA's and breathalyzers.
Fully comply with counseling and programming recommended by DOC.
Obtain/Maintain full time verificable employment.
Full compliance with all family court orders, if paternity has not been established for child(ren), must cooperate to establish paternity.
Pay all costs and surcharges.
DNA sample.

Defendant John William Mosley in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Bond previously posted, case to track along.  Status conference scheduled for February 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  No contact with Kenny's on Main.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
